review: Brand new - so much so that the stench (like bad breath) from the vinyl seating permeated the food - ugh. Waitress was overly sugary sweet and brought a large rather than small onion tower appetizer and three of us ordered bacon burgers that were slightly undercooked. Meal was not worth $50 - no way.

"Can I place an order and pick it up?" "Since we just opened we aren't doing to go orders until 11/8." How hard is it to put the order in a container that it takes two weeks after opening to make that happen?   Don't open if you really aren't ready to open. Although, it's been my experience that there just isn't any decent talent to employ in Dunning.  You can pretty much bank that with any chain, the one in Dunning will be run worse than any other.

So we went to check out the new  Red Robin at the Harlem Irving Mall this week. The hostess told us that we would not have to wait in the lobby for 20 minutes, they'd just text us when a table would be available to me and we'd have 10 minutes to return.Sounded like a simple plan. After over 30 minutes walking the mall starving, we returned to the Red Robin to check our table status. We asked if we had been called since it had been 48 minutes since we had signed up for a table. "Um, I think we just called you" the hostess said as she scrolled through her touch pad. While I am still waiting to see if I have a table yet, a woman walks in and starts asking how she can get a table. "well just give me your cell number and we'll text you when a table is available."says the hostess to this other woman as if I am no longer interested in dining there. "well, I don't have a cell phone" says the woman speaking around my shoulder..As they still are discussing how this other lady is going to get her table,After a while, I remind the hostess that she had left us hanging there after an hour wait time now. The hostess blinked her eyes and apologized. My blood sugar is SO low now all I can say  is "This is bullshit!" The 23 year old manager with the red mustache then told me that my wife and I had to leave for swearing.I wouldn't be swearing if any of the employees of the new Red Robin had been properly trained.  I guess a mass hiring on Monster. Com had it's ups and downs. So I hope that the manager whom I believe they recruited from Wisconsin is very proud of himself for chastising me instead of his employees.What Red Robin corporate doesn't yet know is that I will never spend a dime in this location EVER again! I want my hour back too! PS We were NEVER text that a table was waiting for us that day either.

This Red Robin sucks don't eat here. Hostess put us at a waiter-less table and while we are not being server the other waiters just stare at us like we didn't want to eat. EPIC FAIL!!!!!!!! On a newly built restaurant!!!!

NOT happy with the new Red Robin at the H.I.P.  At the Bears game this weekend everyone with a ticket won a free burger at Red Robin restaurants this Tuesday. Everyone won, all thousands of ticket holders won a free burger with their ticket. So my buddy Chris who got me the ticket to the Bears game came over tonight so we would try out the new Red Robin and get our free burgers. I called Red Robin before going and they confirmed that they were giving free burgers with the Bears tickets. Chris and I get there and the servers act as though they do not know why I am giving them the tickets or anything about the free burgers. We explain to them that we get free burgers and we called ahead of time to confirm this and then the server tells us that it is only the double thin burger from the bar. O.K. by us, no problem. But then she says that it is only one burger per table even though each of us has a Bears ticket. I do not go for this B.S. and she calls a manager over. He says that it is buy one burger to get the second burger free. I again do not go for this expanded B.S. and then he comes up with you have to buy one burger and two drinks to get the free burger ! We walked on principle. F*** Red Robin ! I will not go back and they are stupid to treat me this way because now I have a cause. Copied from FaceBook

Horrible experience to say the very least. Although the server was polite, the manager had to have been on a power trip. I had just turned 21 two months ago so after being carded for ordering a drink, the manager approaches me and says my DL has expired, which was not true, she just had a hard time reading the date. Then after I corrected her on her mistake, she claims due to their "company rules" my vertical drivers license cannot be accepted only because it is not horizontal. It's valid, and I am 21, but I can't order a drink bc it's not a horizontal DL. Absurd! We cancelled our orders and left. Never going to a red robin again.

I am quite a hamburger lover.  This place just blew me away.  The flavor of the burgers are perfect.  I think it is because they toast the bun with Margarine.  Would prefer butter but oh well.  I don't even get it with Mayo so I imagine that it is even more delicious.  I have only tried the basic Gourmet Cheeseburger and the Sweet Potato fries so far.  Want to try some others as well for the future.  The staff is really nice and went out of their way to be accommodating.  Nice beer selection as well which is a big plus.  The fact that the mall has a Chipotle and a Panera is another added bonus if you like those 2 franchises.

I ordered the a1 burger with fries. The waitress was really nice an attentive, she right away came to our table and ask if we will like anything to drink. The burger is really average and the tomatoes were not fresh, the rosemary bread was just ok. The manager was walking around the restaurant and asking how our experience was. I just sincerely feel this place is way overpriced for their food.
We love this new place . Food is good and their service is excellent . Very friendly environment .

Called in an order for pick up Sunday afternoon 1/19/14 they said it would be 20 minutes which I showed up 20 min later , just a burger fries side beans and side mac n cheese, I walk in and hostess says wait at the bar, so I wait and I wait and wait, the bartender does not acknowledge me at all,  I guess if its to go your not important, the whole time I'm there the water is running for no reason a beer is sitting under the tap just foam, every 3 - 4 minutes she'd come and try to fill the glass only to get more foam, this went on for about 15 minutes, finally I said can you please check on my order, she sends one of the waiters in back , he returns and says its not ready,  The bartender explains something in RED ROBIN Lingo that I'm second , I'm like what I've had my order in for 45 min and its not started, she said no and went on in the Red Lingo, I HAD NO IDEA WHAT THAT MEANT , so I wait again,  She defiantly needed help as you could see she could not keep up, I made a comment that she needs some help being I sat there for 45 min unacknowledged, as I watch her scramble  in an unorganized fashion. Definitely to much load for her to handle alone.    Suddenly a Manager went behind the bar for what ever reason, and the Bartender says to him LOUD FOR ME TO HEAR, Oh, guess what I apparently need help, looked at me with a dirty look, at this time the foods came she took it from the waiter that had brought it over and starts making comments to me to mind my own business loudly and ranting some other remarks as I turn and walk out she is still now raising her voice as i am walking away,  OMG, Sunday Bartender , Ignorant, Rude, Immature, Needs desperate Customer Service lessons , Dirty, Sloppy, NEED SOMEONE MORE PROFESSIONAL.  To top it all off , when I finally got home,  My side orders literately  were about a 10 oz cup, SWEAR TO GOD filled about 1 1/2 oz. less than 1/4 of the cup, It reminded me of when you buy a bag of potato chips and the bags blown up with air , and when you open it there 4 chips in there,   NEEDLESS TO SAY SORRY NEVER EVER RETURNING THERE, PLUS THE PRICES ARE RIDICULES. DESERVES 0 STARS

The only reason I am giving this two stars is because our waitress Zayna ( probably butchered this spelling) was amazing and sweet. By far worst burger I have ever had! It was a small patty and over cooked at over 10$ I was shocked to hear this place has gourmet burgers this is a joke!! McDonald's has better burgers then this place and my early dinner felt later as if I ate at McDonald's! Large up charge for garlic fries which were there normal not so amazing fries tossed in a boat load of oil with alittle garlic!! Honestly one of the worst meals I have had for 20$ for 2 burgers and 2 waters I would have rather of got a 1$ mc double at least I know what I'm getting!! I WILL NEVER RETURN!

I want to like this place but it's very inconsistent. The last 5 times I've been here my order is either messed up or it takes forever. They burnt the hell out of my burger and our server was ok this time but usually nowhere to be found. The manager was nice this is why two stars.  I really think the food is good here and I really don't wanna give up on this ace but a hockey puck for a burger is gross.

Red Robin is great at offering a variety of different burgers. Of course Chicago has many bar grill speciality places but if you rather not wait in a long line for a decent burger Robins is the place to go. I'm always satisfied when coming to this location and hopefully you will be too. My fav is the blue ribbon burger.
Carl was an awesome waiter ! We came starving in at 950 trying to eat and he was super accommodating ! Def will be back ! Our burger were also delissssssh!

New location first time here or ever eating at the RR. Friendly service and a large menu of awesome burgers. Food was great and server was polite and knew her stuff. Try it out It if you feel like a burger. Place is very clean and new.

Honestly I like the food and I was happy when they were going to open a location closer to my house instead of going all the way to Skokie.. I was satisfied until I went the bathroom. None of the toilets worked, no papers towel and to top it off it smelled bad. I went out and I saw an employee using the bathroom and in my head I'm thinking why aren't you guys doing anything about it. You know it's dirty. So I get out and asked a waitress to tell her The toilets aren't working and there's no toilet paper. Ive gone a few more times after that but I never will I use the bathroom there, I'll just hold it. I like the place , but you guys have to keep your bathrooms clean .

An American Americans burger place. This place screams gluttony with bottomless rootbeer floats.  Our waiter asked how we would like our burgers cooked. we both said "medium". He confirmed by saying that we want some pink in it. the burgers came out well done. They have so many sauce options that come with an additional charge. it's a bit ridiculous. the beer cocktails looked interesting. upon receiving the check the waiter explained about there frequent eaters reward card. After we paid. he came back to tell us about the survey on the receipt. again, just too much. one bonus star for comfortable seats.

This place sucks with comunication, waited 20 min for a table to be given out by the staff to someone else from the entrance from the mall. then once I was seated, the newbee didnt know the portion size for the fish and chips.Then to top it off, he overbills, and had to wait longer on my corrected receipt. The location at in Skokie has better trained staff that will not overbill you and that knows what sides the kids get a free refill on. Will not go here again

This is the most delicious food ever. 4 stars but only because they usually sit me at the bar even though I always tell them I don't drink. I also realized that sitting near the bar will give you less service and more alone time. If you have a lot if needs, I suggest you ask to be seated in the main area toward the mall. It's more active and you'll be helped much quicker.

The burgers are great. But go there for the French fry sauce!!! The campfire is where it is at. The service was ok and the waitress didn't come around as much as I would have liked. Also, removing a star because they put on mayo on the burger when my wife clearly said no mayo. She hates and loaths it.

Very disappointed in Red Robin... I came in to use my free birthday burger today and was told that I couldn't because I had a coupon on my account. Along with that my server gave me no refills on fries or my drink. Then when I received the check book to pay it was covered in ketchup. So thumbs down for you.

When they say bottomless fries, they literally mean there is no bottom to the fries. It's a container w/no bottom. I've been to only 2 Red Robbins, the one @the HIP sucks donkey balls! Service is nonexistent. If you're hungry plan on eating first before you get there. The food is exceptional but is overshadowed by the poor service.

I live very close by and I've been 4 times now.  I'm over it.  The food is always pretty good but the service is so atrocious that it ruins the whole experience.  And the "bottomless fries" definitely have a bottom when you never see the wait staff and end up begging for the check.  The hostess tonight was particularly awful.  Her: "Party of 6?" (staring at my party of 3 +child). And she smelled like a homeless person.  Not appetizing.  Not ever going back.

Dear Red Robin Manager,  I was recently at your Harlem Avenue location with my husband. We were craving a good, solid burger and decided to stop in here (instead of going to Lead Belly's or any other burger restaurant). In Chicago, we have tons of choices. The service here was incredibly slow. It was not super crowded and it was not super busy. We came way after lunch time. I am downgrading my rating from four stars to three stars. It had been a while since we ate here. I hope the service here improves or this restaurant will not be around much longer at this location. People who go to restaurants today want "an experience" and are seeking quality decent to above average service. Having three young college students at the front greeting customers with "Hello, how are you tonight" upon entering and "Thank you for coming" at the end of the evening as customers leave the restaurant does not cut it -- after all, this is not WalMart. My burger was very, very good and cooked with a little pink in the center -- the way I requested -- the reason I am downgrading your restaurant is because the service was very, very, very slow. In fact, I think a turtle can move faster than the server that we had. As soon as we got our food, which took a long time to be delivered to the table, we were happy to indulge since we had skipped lunch that day. The burgers were juicy, flavorful and tender.  I have no complaints about the burgers. They were worthy of four stars.  I like the steak fries which taste fresh, so consistency is not an issue. Quality Control is in place, so this is a good thing. I ordered the Banzai burger which was topped off with a crisp piece of lettuce, tomatoes, and grilled pineapple. I asked for "no" mayo, because the mayo makes the burger slide all over the place. Sometimes it can even pop out of the bun as you take a bite, so this time around I skipped the mayo all together. I hope the managers read this review, and improve upon service. Our Server was sweet and hospitable. However, it took over five minutes, from the time we were seated, to get a menu dropped off at our table. Why? I don't know. When our check was finally delivered we immediately asked our Server to please take our cash because we didn't want to have "MIA" for another 30-minutes or so. We paid. We ran out of there as fast as our little legs could manage to run!   I'm not sure that I will go here again any time soon -- in fact, I may never go back again. Yeah, it was that bad. Repeat customers (business) is what makes or breaks a restaurant.  Management, please re-train the staff at this location, because from reading these reviews I am not the only person who feels this way. Clearly, there are issues at this restaurant.

If you come here, you want the familiarity of a chain, or you want to grab a bite while out shopping at the mall. Either way, I'll start by saying this is not a destination restaurant. It's more like you're nearby and want a burger. That said, we were seated and our waitress came over quickly. I had a feeling she was new-ish because every time we asked a question, she had to go ask someone for an answer. Not a huge deal, but a little strange. Food came out quickly - the appetizer was out within a few minutes. For some reason, it always took a while for the fries to come out. I guess it's good because that means they make them fresh to order? Maybe? We were checked on often, our drinks were filled, extra napkins were brought, and we were given a fresh order of fries to go straight into our doggie bag. Tip: I joined their loyalty club years ago, and while I haven't frequented the restaurant in about a year, I got an email for a free birthday burger in the month of my birthday. That's why we were there - to cash it in. The tab before the free burger came out to $28 before tip. I'm not sure it would be worth it at that price point, but the free burger brought it down to about $10/person with tip. Look, if you want fantastic food, this isn't the place. If you want a burger a little more upscale from McDonald's with a place to sit, come here. I do think it's one of the better places to eat in the mall.
Food is good atmosphere is good but service lacks I've been there a few times and had below par service

I have never written a review but  I felt the need to share with you my experience I would not have given it one star I was made to wait outside even though they have outdoor seating patio yes I have my dog but usually dogs are let on patios outside I sat there and I waited for the food they're very nice people but the food sucks I drove seven minutes home I have gotten McDonals and drove longer than that and my fries were still warm my burger was not sloppy this burger was not even on the Patty it was shifted the bread was really soggy they need to toast the buns so that they are built to hold the heavy burger.  From the start of the cold fries I didn't even want the burger any longer because I felt like if anything the fries should be warm the burger was cold too so maybe they had is sitting there and didn't see me sitting outside maybe if they hadn't asked me to sit on the patio they would have notice me sitting there waiting for my food. but it was cold I'm highly disappointed and I feel like they owe me $8.00 for eating there and for them to be offering a bottomless fries I know I'm taking my home so they can make them bottomless but I'm pretty sure they could've filled the box with fries there was like 10 steak fries I could count them. Unfortunately I didn't go there to make friends because they are very friendly people but I went there to eat so I don't think I will be eating there again at least not on my own dime sorry or maybe no take out that why I can coach them thou my food
Typical chain restaurant. Food ah. Service horrible. Dirty table. Sad part, it's after lunch with only two tables occupied. Had to wait 30 minutes for a check.  Blah

Only 3 because although food is great when we eat there, take out is horrible. Every order I get for takeout is cold, smashed and usually something missing. Never ordering out from this place again. Sad.

Came here for my brother's birthday. I think the main issue was our waiter. He was not very attentive at all... Honestly one of the worst waiters I've had in a while (and I'm not hard to please). To begin with, he had no personality and barely smiled more than once the entire evening and was barely responsive to questions we asked. At one point he didn't even answer a question someone in our party had.. He just nodded without even looking them in the eye.  Maybe he was having a bad day. But the service was truly bad.  My dad and I both asked for lemon in our water; we got none. (We did get a little cup of lemons when we re-asked). My sister asked for no mayo on her lettuce wrap; it came with mayo. The manager brought out a new one within a few minutes, thankfully. Our drinks were not refilled ONCE. We were not ONCE asked if we wanted or needed refills on drinks or fries (we did). My dad did finally flag down our waiter (which we had to do consistently to get his attention since he rarely stopped by) for a water refill and his request was granted. Did our waiter notice 5 other empty/nearly empty glasses on the table and offer us refills? No...  Also took him a really long time to take our check. The restaurant was hardly busy. All the food we had was decent (apart from the mayo mess up). When we were seated our table didn't have enough napkins set out for our party. The knives set out also looked dirty. We debated asking for new ones but figured we probably wouldn't use them, and it was hard to tell if it was just water spots.  Overall, very unimpressed. Will not be dining again at this location. I think Red Robin is a good chain and I enjoy their food, but it was hard to ignore the very poor service we experienced.

A FULL BEARDED  waiter came to take our order today. I was speechless! I never saw anything like it! I found it so disgusting to think he would have all that hair over our plates of food. After we placed our orders, I told my sister I didn't feel comfortable eating here, but we stayed. Thankfully someone else brought our food to the table. Before we left, I mentioned to the host that I've never seen a waiter with a full beard waiting tables. He said I was the 1st to mention it. Next I contact the Board of Health.

Before I joined yelp, I've had some horrible experience at this Red Robin location.  I swore myself that I would never go back.  Well, my name is Mercy tonight and they shall be granted another chance.  We were seated immediately by the hostess, which was a good sign.  There was a Blackhawks vs. Avalanche game in session.  Well, I guess it was an automatic three (3) stars for this review because Rosa J. Is a happy camper when watching a hockey game.   We ordered the Prime Chophouse with some pink (I really don't like their classification on how to cook the meat; it's either no pink or some pink).  Hubby chose the banzai veggie burger.  Even though this is a burger place, they do have vegetarian options since hubby recently went on a vegetarian diet.   Everything was fine, but not memorable.  Our server wasn't extraordinary but adequate enough to provide a decent service.  We didn't ask for more fries.  By the way, if you ever want more fries, make sure you ask for them.  Otherwise, they would just take your plate away.   We indeed had a better experience, but after all, it's just Red Robin.  I'm really not in a hurry to go back.  We were just walking in the middle of Harlem Ave. in Norridge and this place was just convenient for us.

I been here multiple times. My husband and I weren't too hot about red robin at first but then we ended growing to it. Anyways. I give it 5 stars bc the food is good. Like their juicy burger. We don't have to wait to be seated long, servers aren't bad either. They do their job.
This place has the best gourmet burgers!! Flavor is amazing and so are the choices. Good service and casual ambience. Bottomless fries too! A definite must have!

the most disgusting experience ever. I ordered salsa and chips for an appetizer and almost chocked on a piece of old bacon...(it was inside the salsa) I told the waiter, he took the appetizer away without saying a word!! then I had the burger and sweet potato fries which were cold and saggy. bad experience overall and I will not be returning there again, that piece of bacon inside salsa just threw me off totally
This was not my best experience. We waited almost 30 minutes to get out drinks. That's all that we were having. The bartender had to make our drinks again.

At first quick check-in but then services were a little slow. Room wasn't packed for them to be so busy and there were plenty other waiters/waitresses so I wasn't sure why our waitress wasn't attentive. Room was a tad but cold that I need to keep my jacket on. Foods arrived and were passed to wrong people but our plates had our meals in good shapes so that's all that matter. Love the bottomless drinks.

Celebrating my sons birthday with his crew and my bride. Tried the crab cakes burger and sweet potato fries which was very good. The boys all ordered freckled lemonades and a couple min after drinks arrived Steve the restaurant manager came over with a pitcher and said "I see you guys like this, want to make sure you have refills". Very nice move Steve, I really appreciate good service. Place is packed and clearly it's a reflection of the quality product and people. Shout out to Daniel who went a little further and took great care of us. Thanks very much.

Delicious burgers!!! Our server Zeliha, was great. She was attentive and not overbearing at all. We ordered onion rings which were delicious and the three of us each had a burger. I ordered the cole slaw which was yum! I don't know if its honey mustard they add to it but its not your typical cole slaw. It was great. I have no complaints, I will def head back there when I'm craving a burger!!!!
Worst place ever. People are weird. I don't like people I don't need my servant to try and be my friend. Also, fries were cold.

It's overrated ... Typical food with nothing special. This is the first and last time I will be dining at Red Robin. I order the bacon burger which was okay and had the bottomless fries, which were too salty. I also had the ice cream brownie which was good. But overall the worst part of this restaurant was the service provided by our waitress Dasiy O. Through the whole meal my table was completely avoided and it took over 20 minutes just to ask our waiter for some ketchup and then another 20 to receive our check. By the end of the meal I was left with pains in my neck from stretching over people's heads in order to spot my waitress.

I  was here last night with my 2 kids. I haven't been because I'm not crazy for overpriced burgers,  but since it was my son's birthday I figured it would be worth it.  Our waiter was nice, it seemed he didn't have too much experience with kids, it was ok. NO BIGGIE. Here is why I give I was disappointed: 1. They didn't give us the usual plastic kids cups that the kids usually  get. ( not sure if it's thing of the past since I hadn't been here) They gave us this  regular cups with a lid, which my 2 year old kept spilling of.  2. My son got the mac and cheese which came in first. It was given to him on a glass oven pot, it was extremely hot, it was too watery which caused a bigger mess.  3. My daughter and I got the BOCA (Veggie burgers) I've made this at home and they don't take too much to cook, but this looked undercooked. I got 10 fries with mine, I had to ask for more right away.  I suddenly realize why I hadn't been there for a long time. Overpriced burgers! The fries were good though.  I really would have gotten better food elsewhere even a fast food restaurant. I was looking forward to a balloon for my son, I'm aware of helium shortage so I'm very thankful they use air instead of  helium. They get 5 stars for that. :)

Overall good food, hot and fresh fries and average service. The restaurant is pretty new which is great. Our fries and drinks were kept full and our burgers were good. The service is average, it's what I expect from a burger joint on the mall.

Visited Red Robbins and its was a tasty experience.   The interior is extremely Cool with art all over the place even on the ceiling. The greeter was trying to squish everyone in the same seating area  to make its easier for waitress. So not the best seating arrangements. Tasted the BBQ boneless wings which which were over cooked and rubbery. The Gourmet burger with bacon was excellent and hit a good price point at 10$ and the steak cut fries were ok kinda bland. The fries were unlimited but it seemed like they gave about 4 ounces of fries and then you would have to catch the waitress for more. The shakes were awesome and tasty. Soda is free refills but at 3 dollars a pop you will never drink that much soda! Mixed drink were balanced and tasted great. Nice place for family. The waitress pestered about some kinda of membership program and seemed upset about us not giving up all are personal info for free trinkets.

I took a star off for the prices, I understand that you get "unlimited" fries and a lot of the drinks are "bottomless", however I feel that $8.99 for a cheeseburger at the quality is a little high. Being a vegetarian I appreciate that there are 2 "veggie" burger choices available. I have been to this location and others, and it seems like a company training policy to make sure the wait staff doesn't come by to ever give you more fries, as usually if you want more you have to stop a worker who is not your waiter. A large selection of unique burgers, decent fries which you can hypothetically get as many as you want.

This is my third time here  and as always the service is top notch. My server today gave a smile from the start. Always a great start. She had a bad day so we shared stories and she smiled more. I love the nearby location, easy to get too and close the harlem bus stop. I recommend this location.
Today was my first day at RED ROBIN.The food was great, and our  server  Alicia was amazing.  I Would recommend this place for burger lovers .
Always great food, and the service at this location is superior over the other locations.

This location was pretty good, for the most part. Our server was great in the beginning, but attentiveness swiftly declined. It was like they care about your order, then all they wanna do is flip your table. Which was ridiculous on a hardly busy, Friday night at 8pm. After our waitress (dyed red-head w glasses) took our order, she came around less and less.  She cared about if our food looked okay. I immediately rejected the garlic aioli sauce for dipping my fries in. ( bite-sized garlic pieces! Blech!) but once she gave me chipotle sauce to replace (also mediocre), she was never to be seen again. We hadn't even both bit into burgers at this point. Usually it'd be good for a 2-5 minute checkup after food dropoff.  The manager came by... 10 minutes after my drink was emptied, without a recheck from our server. Essentially, the only time she came back, since swappin out sauces, was to drop off our bill. In fact, she asked if we wanted our dessert, as we dropped our bill off. I felt that was a little presumptuous. More understandable if the restaurant was busy. I'm sure it would not have been a big deal to ring out another receipt, but didn't really show an interest in selling dessert.  (I later saw some boozy drinks I wanted to try, like a blue moon float or a bailey's shake... but considering the iffy service, I opted out). *shrug* after we paid our bill, there was no interest in us any longer.  No refills on fries, no refills on drinks, shabby service on a half-full house on Friday. For a mall-attached Red Robin, I have seen worse.. so the 3 will suffice, but I won't rave further.

Since having a bad experience at the RR in Skokie, we decided to try this one in Norridge. It was a completely different story! The staff were friendly, attentive, and our meal was accurate!  Our food was delicious, cooked to the temp we requested, and served with a smile! The place was clean and we did not observe any of the safety problems we saw at the other store.  It was a pleasant dinner!

Oh why do I keep giving this place chances? There has been only bad experiences here, but since it's the only place at the HIP that serves booze,  I find a reason to come in.  The hostess didn't know where to seat me, even though there was a very empty dining room. We actually walked in a circle before she sat me at a table right next to a huge family with screaming kids. Not to mention the birthday party going on in front of me. The staff seemed just as happy as I was about that  The table wasn't clean, I ended up taking out hand sanitizer and wiping it down, Really? I ordered a vegan burger- the only non-meat thing on the menu. It was very rubbery and salty. The worst was how it was swimming in mayonnaise!!! I might as well have eaten right out of the Holman's jar. Beer was good, you can't really screw that up. Like I said, the booze keeps this place open. If you have ever taken a trip to the HIP, you will need a drink. This place is great to cope through holiday shopping.
Had a burger that was super tasty and I totally took advantage of the bottomless fries. It was a nice clean restaurant with extremely friendly staff.
When this location first opened it was so clean and the service was great. Now it isn't the same, food is still good.

I went to this location for the first time I waited a little while before being seates. I came because I was craving the onion ring tower which was amazing and all the food was great. Customer service was meh, she was nice but not anything out of the ordinary. Everything was delicious! Yummy! Fresh and didn't take long.

We had a party of 15 the burgers were far from gourmet. We ordered onion rings off the machine do you think they ckd the order, we wanted onion rings for 8 people not 8 plates. Do you know why it's bottomless fries, because the fries are cold and greasy! And we were sitting close to the kitchen! I can't believe you have so many red robins rename it red robbers because you are robbing the public

Great service,awesome Burgers,Great sides.stop in here yesterday for lunch and me and Mrs had a great experience.beautiful decor nice seating etc.etc. I will highly recommend this place for awesome Burgers & Brews&sides

I recently ate at the Red Robin that is part of the Harlem-Irving Plaza mall, but not a part of the mall's super-blah food court.  The restaurant is larger that it may appear, as it has an entrance from the exterior parking area and also an interior entrance from within the mall.  The bar area looks lively enough, with fun decorative elements hanging from the ceiling. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger, which I sometimes order from the downtown Red Robin Burger Works outlets.  All burgers at the regular Red Robin come with a bottomless side of steak fries, but for a slight upcharge I went with the sweet potato fries.  My server even mentioned that this burger contained barbeque sauce and mayo and if I was fine with that, so I thought that was nice of him to ask.  I also enjoyed the mint brownie shake, so when I was offered more fries I declined since I would have had no room to finish the shake.  The most unique item for me was this little device on the table which displayed various ads throughout my meal.  When it was time to pay up, the device became a credit card reader that also printed out my receipt.  A good burger-centric meal, and a bit of cool technology too.
The manager Erin was very considerate and helpful. Our server KC was fantastic too. I'll be back just for the great customer service!
Sat for 15 minutes without anyone even coming up to take our drink order. This place sucks.

So we decided to dine in at Red Robin today and the food was great!  The tower of onions rings was amazing as usual. We also ordered spinach artichoke dip which lacked in flavor (to me at least).  Other than that, burgers and fries were delicious. Service was fast and friendly. Establishment was clean, there wasn't a long wait and good parking.

It's one of the most contrived chains on the planet and they're doing the interior design like 1990 on steroids.   The burgers are not great for a place specializing on said dish and no matter how many "specialty burger" combintions they come up with, if the burger itself isn't good, then they haven't a chance.  Do yourself a favor and... [x] give it a miss
These burgers are seriously the best! Service isn't great but we still go for the good food. Try the burnin' love burger and the onion rings!!! Mozzarella sticks are amazing too.
I did not like the meat they served with the cheese burger. And the waiter was pretty rude and impatient not acknowledging who i was, a costumer.

We haven't even received our food yet, and already I feel like this establishment might as well close. Every single employee looks like a miserable stick in the mud. Absolutely ZERO smiles and the energy in here is pure SUCK!!! I hope the food at least tastes decent, but as we enter the 24th minute of waiting for some pretty simple choices (2 kids meal options with salads....what's taking so long?!!! & a wrap with bottomless fries....) Ok. The decent food arrived. It's mediocre & as I watch the "host" drag his feet & the manager approaches at the MOST inappropriate & awkward time whilst I take a massive bite of my not great food so we could get out of here. He asks how everything is & I'm literally chewing and glaring. As management of a food establishment, please learn the appropriate time to approach a patron. This place sucks. We will never return.

I usually only come here for the unlimited refills of drink and fries! Nothing could go wrong with those two combinations . The only downside is when you want more fries it is only one small serving each time.  There's a wide variety of burgers to choose from but honesty the burgers are nothing special. I think the only good thing about this place Are the unlimited refills and bottomless fries. There's also alcohol available and the price is okay. A bottled beer is around $5.  Will come back again for sure but only once in a while.

When you think Red Robin, you think of BOTTOMLESS STEAK FRIES! My God are they addicting! Every time I go eat at Red Robin they seemed to have expand their menu more and more which is always a good thing; I'm not one to always eat the same thing every time at a restaurant. All of their burgers are wonderful, their TVs are nice and huge so perfect for watching a game.
Really good burgers. They have new heard and perm fries, yum! The service is really good and attentive. The place is new and very clean.
Red Robin was wonderful.  They always have great service and great food.  We go here often do to this reason.  Yummmmmmm good!

Zac the waiter (server) was very passionate and friendly my family truly enjoyed the gourmet bacon burgers they just melts in your mouth & the bottom less fries the garlic herbs was off the chart keep them coming ,the manager Jackie came to our table 2 explain the hold up on our 2 towers of onions rings because my appetizers suppose 2 come before my food her reason was they dropped a tower W..T.Who.......thank god our table was directly across from the kitchen & my glasses were clean enough 2 see straight 2 the back all I can here was Oh No .....the whole kitchen was in motion like grab the fire extinguisher ....it's getting hot in here. ...lol .....Jackie offers us a tray of bottom less fries on her thanks those 10 fries were fresh,hot & soft  I'm satisfied we'll be back thanks we needed that giggle our table was packed to where we needed 2 tables it was only 4 of us zac looking like who's eating what & where is the drinks   going ....#.my son favorite place

I stopped at this Red Robin on my way to the airport. The location was easy to get to and only 10 minutes away from O'Hare.  There was no wait and I was seated right away. The restaurant was freezing, and I had to wear my jacket the entire time.  Our staff was okay. She appeared every once and awhile, but was not present throughout the experience.  Before placing my order I asked for my side of bottomless fries to be brought out. They were delicious. As I waited for my entree- which took entirely too long- I ordered a second round of fries (they are bottomless after all). The second batch wasn't hot and tasted stale, not worth eating.  For my entree I ordered the new Black and Blue Burger, part of the "Red Robin Finest" line of food. The burger is pictured on a ciabatta bun topped with a pile of cheese. The picture was misleading. While the bun was delicious, there was hardly any blue cheese on the burger- there was a sprinkling of a few blue cheese crumbs- but that was it. The rest of the burger was good but had to be eaten with a knife and fork.   While I am a huge Red Robin fan, I don't think I would make my way back to this specific location.
The food is good and is a good price.  The place is usually crowded.  I like the interior.  Parking can also be hard to find.

I like the food, but I don't like the prices. The prices are especially bad on certain items, such as the Clucks & Fries. You only get four tenders, and if you carry out, they make sure to give you a scanty amount of fries, even though they are bottomless when you eat inside. I don't understand why the garlic fries are always different when I order them for an upcharge. Sometimes you get a ton of garlic flavor and parmesan cheese, other times you get little garlic flavor and no cheese at all. If someone pays to upgrade, why would they want fries that are basically the same as the plain ones?  The tenders can also run very small, like the size of a large potato chip. A box full of small tenders does not put me in a good mood, since you only get four in the first place, I suppose I shouldn't say a box full. I am glad that they finally got online ordering. No more sitting forever at the counter waiting for food.  If you decide to get tenders, make sure to get some garlic aioli sauce and poppy-seed honey mustard, if you like those sort of flavors. Avoid the Roy Rogers soda at ALL costs, unless you like drinking medicine. The fried mushrooms...I had a double order of the most flavorless fried mushrooms I've ever eaten. You get 10 for $7. That's not a very good deal. They get soggy really quick. I had to put them in the oven after I got home less than two hours later. I put some garlic salt on them to add flavor.
The squire was negligent. Never asked me if i was enjoying my dish. Did not supply my needs when it came to bottomless fries. A decent proposal would be bottomless burgers so they can finally close.
Came with the wife to enjoy some burgers. This is the only place where she actually enjoy the burgers and finishes it all. Service was great.

Food is pretty good, however the staff here is lacking. Wearing a t-shirt and shorts does not present a quality business. Also it took forever for them to sit us drown. But besides their staff, it is among my top choices.

Yes 5 stars. It's a chain, I know this but I love everything about this place.  They are courteous, the place is clean and the food is prepared well. The prices are so reasonable!! When I visit the mall, I love to make this my stop to have a bite to eat.

Red Robin's is very affordable and has a nice ambiance. I went to Red Robin's to snack on some appetizers after shopping at Harlem Irving Plaza.  We ordered the towering onion rings which consisted of 13 delicious onion rings. It comes with two different sauces. I would order this again, if I ever went back to Red Robin's in the future. We also ordered the Guac, Sala and Chips. This wasn't my favorite. The chips were great; however, the salsa and the guac just didn't do. It was very salty and guac wasn't fresh.  Apart from these, we ordered a chicken tortilla soup. It was decent, but I don't think I'd order this again. The crispy  tortilla was a nice addition the soup.  Apart from the food itself, the staff were kind and courteous. The place is clean and is definitely a great spot to stop by after shopping at the mall. Paying my bill was so easy and fast with the table top kiosk.  Overall, it was a good experience!

This was my second time going to this location & probaly the last. We waited maybe 15 minutes for our waitor & another 30 minutes for our food. When our food came, it was cold. We asked for refill on fries & drinks and got the drinks 20 minutes later. A family that was seated after us was given their drinks 30-40 minutes after they arrived & never had the chance to even eat. We were later informed that a cook walked off the job & manager was in the kitchen cooking (under staffed). We never received the refill of fries & another customer also walked out.

The main food is ok but the sides are horrible.   The service is the worst.  I have yet to be at a red robin and have good service.  They must use only untrained staff and once they know what they're doing they leave.  Don't waist your time going here.

I wanted to share an awesome experience we had tonight at Red Robin. We go there frequently as it's my son's favorite. Today is his birthday and he chose to go there for dinner. Service was a little slow and our food arrived cold. We mentioned it to our waitress but didn't want to send the food back because we were starving. The manager came over and went out of his way to make the situation right. He was so nice that even my 9 year old commented on it when he walked away. He even went out of his way to find my son a treat that was peanut free because of his allergy. We so appreciated his outstanding customer service and made what could of been a disappointing dinner a great one. Thank you so much.

So we went there on a Sunday afternoon. The front section of the restaurant was empty but the back was very crowded. Also this is by the HIP mall and an Xsport fitness, so they all share parking, so it was very difficult to park.  The menu is a bit confusing since they separate gourmet burgers from regular burgers from their tavern menu - basically 4 sections of burgers. Too many options, which is good that's not a bad thing - unless you are like me you get overwhelmed - but it's good. They do have all the combination of toppings on a burger you could think off - bacon eggs mushrooms pineapple chili fried onion guacamole - seriously a lot.  I think they are known for their gigantic onion ring tower - which we didn't order. We ordered the creamy spinach and artichoke dip - that was creamy and yummy, however the chips were not enough for the dip, we asked for a little more. We also got the bruschetta chicken sandwich - that was also good, and then my friend's son got a well-don burger (ok I agree, no one should ever get a well done burger) but it wasn't well done, it was burned. Well done should just contain no red at all, not look like it might be a burger -  but too burned to tell.  I got the salmon and the brocoli dish - to my surprise, not dry, not over-salty, and no butter. The strawberry lemonade thing is really good too, and is bottomless.  Overall ok.
